Posts.Content: Oct 15, 2014 02:52PM ElizabethAnne14 wrote: I am 21 years old and have had a sever pain in my right breast for about 3 months.  The pain is in one centralized area under my nipple, and hurts very bad ween presses on and continues to hurt for a few seconds after it has been pressed.  I do not feel a prominent lump.  Recently, one dark blue vein has shown up running under the bottom side of by breast under the nipple where the pain is occurring.  Should I be concerned about this?  I also have no family history of breast cancer, and have been on birth control for about 6 years because my periods were so bad.  Thank you in advance for any help!!!!
Posts.Title: New here and scared Sunkat1080 Sunkat1080

Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2011 09:58PM ElizabethAnne wrote: Hi Tanya, I completely understand the reason why you want to appear strong for everyone, including your parents.   Although I'm sure they would completely understand if they knew you were worried, it makes sense that you don't want to worry them. Waiting is the hardest part sometimes.  As CanDsMom said, statistics are really on your side, so that's something to feel good about.  Just try to stay busy for the next few days and try to have some fun.   When you're busy, it keeps your mind off the waiting. I'll be praying for you!   (your parents are so fortunate to have such a caring daughter!) Elizabeth Anne
Posts.Title: 22 YEAR OLD AWAITING BIOPSY Tanya22 dragonfly55

Posts.Content: Mar 31, 2011 11:07PM ElizabethAnne wrote: Glad to have found these posts.   I'm in the same group as all of you.   I am stage 1, no lymph node involvement, no chemo, just rads.   But so many people have made so many comments about "you should feel lucky" (including my doctors) that I feel guilty to be having any negative thoughts about being diagnosed with cancer.   It feels like people think I'm dealing with a mild case of the flu. Maybe it's my fault for downplaying it to everyone I talk to at first.  It was ME that kept trying to reassure people that everything was going to be okay and that I caught it early. Ho Hum.....
Posts.Title: Depression Over Good Prognosis? huntreiter3 Momine

Posts.Content: Feb 14, 2011 09:25PM ElizabethAnne wrote: Hello friends, Checking in to say hello.  And to say thanks to everyone for all of your posts.  I haven't started rads yet (or even met my doctor yet), but I have already learned so much from all of you. What a good feeling to all of you who have finished...what a wonderful accomplishment!
Posts.Title: February 2011 Rads ToriGirl Elisimo

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2011 12:33AM ElizabethAnne wrote: Hello everyone, I may end up being a February 2011 rad partner, but things are moving slower than I thought, so I might end up falling in the March group.   I have a question for all of you:  if you had a lumpectomy with no chemo, how long after your surgery did you meet with your rad doctor and how long before you started radiation?  This website is such a great source of support!
Posts.Title: February 2011 Rads ToriGirl Elisimo

Posts.Content: Mar 31, 2011 10:13PM ElizabethAnne wrote: All:  I'm so glad I happened upon this group! Victoryismine:  I had the same questions as you at first.  I didn't know which doctor to see first and I didn't get much guidance.  I ended up seeing surgeon, then MO, then RO.  It turned out fine and afterwards they told me it would not have mattered who I saw first because they coordinate treatment. Raincitygirl:  My diagnosis looks identical to yours.  I'm now 1/2 way through radiation. Denial?  I'm really trying to figure out my non-reaction to all of this.  I've strolled through the last 3 months in a fog and I can't seem to summon up any emotion.  Tears occasionally erupt at all the wrong times, but there is no rhyme or reason for it. The few times tears have come, they are close to the surface and pretty irrational.   I'm waiting for some sort of emotion to hit me, but it hasn't.  Sometimes I wonder if my mind is avoiding thinking about it because it's easier to accept that way.    I just can't figure it out.
Posts.Title: Which to See First - Radiologist or Oncologist? victoryismine2 Anjanita
